data.title: glfw and glew not found on cmake with Mingw
data.body:
:\Users\lyt\Documents\GitHub\helloworld>cmake -G "MinGW Makefiles" .
-- The C compiler identification is GNU 5.2.0
-- The CXX compiler identification is GNU 5.2.0
-- Check for working C compiler: C:/Program Files/mingw-w64/x86_64-5.2.0-posix-seh-rt_v4-rev0/mingw64/bin/gcc.exe
-- Check for working C compiler: C:/Program Files/mingw-w64/x86_64-5.2.0-posix-seh-rt_v4-rev0/mingw64/bin/gcc.exe -- works
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info
-- Detecting C compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting C compile features
-- Detecting C compile features - done
-- Check for working CXX compiler: C:/Program Files/mingw-w64/x86_64-5.2.0-posix-seh-rt_v4-rev0/mingw64/bin/g++.exe
-- Check for working CXX compiler: C:/Program Files/mingw-w64/x86_64-5.2.0-posix-seh-rt_v4-rev0/mingw64/bin/g++.exe -- works
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info
-- Detecting CXX compiler ABI info - done
-- Detecting CXX compile features
-- Detecting CXX compile features - done
It appears you are builing natively for Windows Desktop with Mingw GCC
-- Found OpenGL: opengl32
-- OpenGL include dirs:
CMake Error at C:/Program Files (x86)/CMake/share/cmake-3.4/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:148 (message):
  Could NOT find GLEW (missing: GLEW_INCLUDE_DIR)
Call Stack (most recent call first):
  C:/Program Files (x86)/CMake/share/cmake-3.4/Modules/FindPackageHandleStandardArgs.cmake:388 (_FPHSA_FAILURE_MESSAGE)
  C:/Program Files (x86)/CMake/share/cmake-3.4/Modules/FindGLEW.cmake:44 (find_package_handle_standard_args)
  cocos2d/cmake/Modules/CocosBuildHelpers.cmake:44 (find_package)
  cocos2d/CMakeLists.txt:190 (cocos_find_package)

-- Configuring incomplete, errors occurred!
See also "C:/Users/lyt/Documents/GitHub/helloworld/CMakeFiles/CMakeOutput.log".
See also "C:/Users/lyt/Documents/GitHub/helloworld/CMakeFiles/CMakeError.log".

data.title: added feature ListView select item by index
fix Keyboard fails to hide on iOS.
jumpToItem in ListView doesn't work properly if called just after creation.
Fixed assert statement. Added name to physic component.
Fix keyboard won't dismiss on iOS issue
PageView doesn't support custom threshold
data.body:
@neokim  
What's your plan for adding this missing feature back? The next release cycle is December 2, so time is very limited.

data.title: Remove boring logs in cocos studio supporting module.
data.body:
They are helpless for debugging, we should use break points for debugging.

They are really boring and useless, I just load one `csb` I got:

data.title: 3d model,fbx convert to c3b
data.body:
i have two problems
first: fbx convert to c3b,in 3dmax,the z axis is up, in cocos2dx, the y axis is up,but,it is cocos2dx 3.5 before, convert to c3b is normal, it is cocos2dx 3.5 after, i have to rotate 90 around the x axis. cocos2dx 3.5 after,3dmax convert to fbx, We should pay attention to what?

data.title: Change ASSERT to safety mode
data.body:
Remove condition MACRO and change ASERT into safety mode. As the discuss result at http://discuss.cocos2d-x.org/t/make-assert-safe-in-release-mode/25115/6. The change of CCBundle3D has been confirmed by @super626 already.

@ricardoquesada @minggo Please review this PR.

Fix button texture loaded mark has set to wrong value bug

bugfix:#14477 Keyboard fails to hide when the outside area of keyboard is touched while using EditBox on ios 7.1
js slow loading cocostudio json file
data.body: Loading json mechanism is desirable to provide a C ++

data.title: Fixed build for mingw and android with CMake.
data.body:
Added option in CMake to be able build Box2D without using it as physics library in cocos2d-x (similar to what is done in the Visual Studio solution).
Updated android.toolchain.cmake from https://github.com/taka-no-me/android-cmake/commit/556cc14296c226f753a3778d99d8b60778b7df4f and added c++_shared support.

Tested with CMake builds for MinGW and Android; and a Visual Studio build to check that no regression occurred.

data.title: Added a mechanism of delayed autorelease for objects created in background threads
data.body:
With this change, it is now possible to create autorelease objects from the background threads created by the async task pool.
Before this change, they could be released by the autorelease pool (in the main thread) before they could be retained or their reference count incremented (in the background thread).

The change has no impact on objects created from the main thread, it works as before. The only addition is the current thread id check which is performed in negligible time (30 nanoseconds on Windows, 150 nanoseconds on Android - based on 100k checks).

The change was tested on Windows (with Visual Studio and MinGW) and Android.
We don't have access to the other cocos2d-x supported platforms, but nothing in the changeset is platform dependent.
